Ok now onto my story, I believe I was younger than 10 when this happened. My sister and I got up in the middle of the night because we realised we hadnâ€™t closed the chicken coop, we were worried they would be killed by foxes so we got up to close the coop door. While my sister was unlocking the front door in the living room I had grabbed the torch, turned it on and started swinging it around back and forth. As I moved the light toward the fireplace in the room I saw a white rag. It was torn at the bottom and a very pale bright white colour, it was hanging in the air covering an old painting of a garden. As I moved the flashlight upwards the rag got wider until it took the shape of the bottom of a dress. I moved the light and got to what I believe was below the waist before I freaked out and moved the light off it completely. But when I moved it back it was gone like it has never been there.   The reason I moved the light away is because I just felt it would be bad if I saw a face like I thought it and got a bad feeling about moving the light higher.  Can anyone help me understand what I saw

I grew up in a small town in rural NSW Australia and our town pool was made on top of what was once a cemetery. When the town started to grow they decided to move the cemetery and they crushed up the tomb stones to make into paths. Another local place that we would go to growing up that was family orientated was a man made lake and when they created it they decided to leave the church and cemetery so whenever there is a drought the water levels drop and the church and tomb stones arise.

I don't care what anyone says, I missed Shane, and I am SO glad he's back!! I've been a fan of Shane's for so long that when he was "cancelled" in the summer of 2020, I was already aware of most of the things he was getting cancelled for. And over the years, he had already apologized for like 97% of those things. So I felt like I had already forgiven him for the immature/edgy crap he was known for doing early in his career. I had watched his content go from being super immature, and totally dependent on shock value, to the incredibly awesome series that he's been known for making the last few years. Internet humor was also much different back when YouTube was just starting out. Very few things weren't allowed to be shown, and people could pretty much say and do whatever they wanted. It was totally unlike what people were used to seeing in every day, traditional media. That was one of the things that made watching videos online so desirable. And the people who were saying the most ridiculous and shocking things were getting the most attention from the young people of my generation who were looking to find the next best shocking and/or hilarious viral video. So yes, I'm very happy that Shane is back. I feel like there will always be a place for his content on YouTube. And I know that I'm not the only one who doesn't want to let other people dictate what content I should and shouldn't enjoy online. I missed you Shane, Ryland, and Morgan!!! Thanks for coming back right when your content was needed the most!!ğŸ˜ŠğŸ¤ğŸ’«âœ¨

I grew up in Aurora and third bridge was a huge deal to go to. We used to pack our car up in the middle of the night with no phone's ( I'm old ha ha) to try and hear the drums beating and stuff. But it was the middle of nowhere and the terrain was rough to try and navigate in the dark. I ended up breaking my leg because there was a cow crossing grate in the ground I didn't see and my leg slipped through and down I went lol. We grew up knowing about the sandcreek massacre and what happened there. Looking back we're probably lucky we didn't get shot going on private property in the middle of the night.
I need to look into the massacre to find out what evidence was found to prove the governor was responsible, was there a journal or something? Or do people just assume he did this fucked up thing?

Always a great night when there's a Shane video to watch. :) That same thing happened half a block away from my house. When they extended our street to make room for a subdivision and nursing homes, they accidently dug up bodies from a really, really old cemetery that was supposed to have been moved years before. Instead, the contractor just moved the headstones. There was also a second location in town where it happened too. In the end, work had to be halted while all the bodies were relocated. Unfortunately, they all wound up being reburied in a mass grave because none were identifiable by then.  So sad. :(

My great grandma was 1 of 4 kids. She had 1 older bother and 2 older sisters that were twins. She use to tall me all the time about a little boy and girl that ran around playing in her house. She was old so I just thought maybe she was confused and it was actually her grandkids playing. But then when the 2nd twin died like a month later my grandma said there were 2 little blonde girls playing and 1 boy. She never seen them straight on just in corner of her eyes and could her laughter and they would say her name too. One day she was watching TV and she said the boy stood directly in front of the television and my GMA realized it was her brother and her sisters, waiting for her. Another time maybe a week before gma died she was in her room and the family could hear her speaking to our great grandpa who had been gone for almost 15 years, grandma said to him, when are you gonna come get me, I miss you and am ready to see you. When my husband died(he passed young) I kind of stopped believing in ghosts. The major thing that makes me think maybe, is a video I captured, that many years ago, me and him went to a cemetery and it was during the day. We stopped to read a historical plaque of this tiny run down cemetery. I was fine, until we were about to walk towards this one area and I got this overwhelming feeling that something was there, just total dread and fear. I turned on my crappy digital camera and took a quick video. We left, went to taco bell, I came home and watched the video clip and freaked out. There's this red human shaped figure walking right where I was afraid of walking to. We were alone, I would love a logical answer to what this thing was, I've watched the video countless timesğŸ˜‚ it's actually up on my channel(I'm not a YouTuber lol I just posted it to my channel for my mother in law, because you can hear my late husband talking in the clip)
